text:
This "bug" is reproducible every time and happens on all paltforms.

When using the move task to rename a relatively big folder (+10000files) the
move task counts the files and this takes up a lot of time. (e.g. 12000files ~
3-4 minutes).

I would like to have a flag in the <move>-task to disable this count system when
renaming folders.
creator: antti.lammi@gmail.com
monsieur.haynes@gmail.com
text:
The Move class is an extension of the Copy class. Files to be moved / copied are
mapped to a Hashtable. The size of the hashtable is the count that gets
outputted on the command line, using the size() method of the Hashtable object. 

From what I can see, using the size() method to output the file count on the
command line is not the reason for the amount of time the tasks takes. The use
of the size() method is still necessary for functionality other than simply
echoing the number of files moved.

Ant scans whether the whole tree can be moved via rename or whether it has to copy files individually - the later could happen if the tree contains files or directories that are excluded.

It is this scanning of the directory tree, not the counting of files that takes uo the time - and it cannot be avoided.
creator: bodewig@apache.org
